alert.note: Alert for Apache (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 16 at 2:49PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT NEAR SHOW LOW AND PINETOP AND LAKESIDE AREAS UNTIL 6 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Arizona, including the following counties, Apache and Navajo. * WHEN...Until 600 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 247 PM MST, trained weather spotters reported heavy rain in Pinetop-Lakeside resulting in minor flooding. Between 0.75 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Pinetop-Lakeside is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Linden Draw, Cottonwood Wash, Day Wash, Billy Creek, Canal, The, Walnut Creek, Cottonwood Canyon, Bear Flat Creek, Gooseberry Creek, Porter Creek, Pine Creek, Lone Pine Creek, Brown Creek, Show Low Creek, North Fork White River, Trout Creek, Dodson Wash, Corduroy Creek, Hay Hollow Draw, Silver Creek, Cedar Creek, East Cedar Creek, Rocky Arroyo and Thompson Creek. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Show Low, Pinetop-lakeside, Taylor, Wagon Wheel, Shumway, Lake Of The Woods--Pinetop-lakeside, Hondah, North Fork, Fort Apache Reservation, Snowflake, Fool Hollow Lake Campground, White Mountain Lake, Scott Reservoir Campground, Lakeside Campground, Pinetop Country Club and Mcnary. - This includes the following highways... State Route 260 between mile markers 345 and 361. Highway 60 between mile markers 340 and 351. State Route 73 between mile markers 352 and 357. State Route 277 between mile markers 324 and 333. State Route 77 between mile markers 343 and 360. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
